greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Shift one instance of the smallest prime one step towards smaller primes: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = n, and for odd numbers > 1: a(n) = (n / prime(s)) * prime(s-1), where s = A055396(n), index of the smallest prime dividing n.
comment: Iterating from any n as a(n), a(a(n)), a(a(a(n))), etc. reaches 1 after A056239(n) iterations.
Even bisection gives the natural numbers A000027, the odd bisection from the third term onward is A129128: 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 11, 10, ...
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(1) = 1; for n>1: a(n) = A008578(A055396(n)) * A032742(n). [Compare to the similar formula of A064989.]
mathematica: Array[a, n]]; a252461[84] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 21 2014 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 20 2014
